Column Comment.0: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.1: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: PRODUCT TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of product (fluid) such asGAS, OIL, WATER, NGL, etc. Includes the less common products like STEAM,METHANE, BUTANE, HELIUM, etc.
Column Comment.4: CASE ID: A model of proposed production for a production entity. A forecast may becomprised of one or more segments and one or more fluids or fluid ratios.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: CASE NAME: full or long name given to the case study.
Column Comment.7: CLOSE DATE: the calendar year and month of the close period assigned to thisbalance.
Column Comment.8: CLOSE DATE: the calendar year and month of the close period assigned to thisbalance.
Column Comment.9: CO2 PERCENT: The percentage of carbon dioxide in the gas at the time of materialbalance.
Column Comment.10: CRITICAL PRESSURE: the critical pressure defined at the time of the materialbalance analysis.
Column Comment.12: CRITICAL TEMPERATURE: the critical temperature defined at the time of thematerial balance analysis.
Column Comment.14: CUMMULATIVE VOLUME: the cummulative production volume that has been usedto calculate the remaining recoverable.
Column Comment.15: CUMMULATIVE VOLUME DATE: the date that the cummulative volume was taken,such as cummulative volumes taken up to 09-2002.
Column Comment.16: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.19: CURVE FIT ERROR: the margin of error in the best fit of the data to produce thiscurve.
Column Comment.20: CURVE FIT TYPE: the type of curve, such as manual fit, best fit, weighted best fit.
Column Comment.21: CURVE INTERCEPT: The curve intercept on the y axis for the material balancecurve.
Column Comment.22: CURVE NAME: The name given to this analysis series by the analyst.
Column Comment.23: CURVE SLOPE: The slope of the material balance cuve on a pressure cumulativeproduction curve.
Column Comment.24: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.25: END DATE: End date for this decline segment.
Column Comment.26: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.27: FINAL CUMMULATIVE VOLUME: The final cummulative volume at the end of thematerial balance curve.
Column Comment.30: FINAL PRESSURE: the ending pressure of the material balance curve.
Column Comment.32: GAS ABANDONMENT PRESSURE: the pressure at abandonment
Column Comment.34: GAS ABANDONMENT RECOVERY FACTOR: The gas recovery factor atabandonment.
Column Comment.35: H2S PERCENT: The percent of hydrogen sulphide in the gas at the time of materialbalance.
Column Comment.36: INITIAL CUMMULATIVE VOLUME: the cummulative volume that was used at thestart fo material balance curve.
Column Comment.39: INITIAL PRESSURE: the initial pressure at the start of the material balance curve.
Column Comment.41: INITIAL TEMPERATURE: the initial temperature used during the material balance.
Column Comment.43: MEASURED PRESSURES INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that measuredpressures were used in the analysis. If set to Y, indicates pressures were measured.If set to N, indicates that the measurements have been adjusted. This column doesnot describe how pressures were adjusted, only that they were.
Column Comment.44: N2 PERCENT: The percent of nitrogen in the gas at the time of analysis.
Column Comment.45: ORIGINAL GAS IN PLACE: the volume of original gas.
Column Comment.46: POOL DATUM DEPTH: The depth at pool datum.
Column Comment.48: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.49: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a project that has resulted in thecreation of a decline analysis and forecast.
Column Comment.50: RECOVERABLE GAS IN PLACE: the volume of recoverable gas that is in place fromthis material balance analysis.
Column Comment.51: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.52: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.53: SPECIFIC GRAVITY: the specific gravity associated with the material balanceanalysis.
Column Comment.54: START DATE: Start date for this decline segment.
Column Comment.55: SURFACE LOSS PERCENT: The percent of surface loss from the production of thegas.
Column Comment.56: VOLUME: Total volume for this decline segment.
Column Comment.59: ZERO PRESSURES INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether zero pressurereadings were included in the analysis. A Y indicates that zero readings are included,a N indicates that they were not.
Column Comment.60: COMPRESSIBILITY FACTORE METHOD: the method used to determine thecompresibility factor.
Column Comment.61: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.62: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.63: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.64: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.65: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.66: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.67: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
